intro: Argostemma spinulosum, commonly known as the spiny argostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
